newsitem.title: USA: Air tour group sues FAA on Rocky Mountain flight ban.
newsitem.headline: Air tour group sues FAA on Rocky Mountain flight ban.

text.p: The United States Air Tour Association on Tuesday sued the Federal Aviation Administration over the FAA's ban on sightseeing tour flights over Rocky Mountain National Park.
The lawsuit, which follows a similar suit filed against the FAA's limits on tour flights over Grand Canyon National Park, was filed in the U.S. Court of Appeals.
The FAA announced the ban last week in a move to block plans that were in the works to start up tour flights over Rocky Mountain park, which currently does not have such tours.
The Clinton administration has announced measures in recent weeks to reduce the noise from tour flights over national parks, which it says mars the wilderness experience.
The measures do not affect general commercial aviation.

"The FAA ban on air tours where there are none is arbitrary and excessive and establishes a dangerous precedent that air tours can simply be excluded without any evidence of adverse impacts," Donald Elliott, an attorney representing the air tour group, said in a statement.
